page.title: 14Ecology in Stock
page.content: Early in July we went for a walk in Temple Wood Stock. We found the trees were mostly sweet or spanish chestnut.These give us the chestnuts that we can roast and eat in the Autumn. It is the horse chestnut which give us conkers which children play with in the Autumn. We found some old dried up chestnuts some had holes in where squirrels and insects had eaten them. We found dead bluebells and bracken and a lot of moss called eurynchium. The wood was quiet and very peacefull, we heard all the insects buzzing around. Conkers is a game where you make a hole in the conker or horse chestnut and put a piece of string through the conker & then you hold the conker at the end of the string and another person tries to break your conker with his and then you try to break his.
